verses.text_plain: And Ben–hadad the king of Syria gathered all his host together: and there were thirty and two kings with him, and horses, and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and warred against it.
verses.verse_html: 1And Ben–hadad the king of Syria gathered all his host together: and there were thirty and two kings with him, and horses, and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and warred against it.

verses.text_plain: And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said unto him, Thus saith Ben–hadad,
verses.verse_html: 2And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said unto him, Thus saith Ben–hadad,

verses.text_plain: Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy wives also and thy children, even the goodliest, are mine.
verses.verse_html: 3Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy wives also and thy children, even the goodliest, are mine.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel answered and said, My lord, O king, according to thy saying, I am thine, and all that I have.
verses.verse_html: 4And the king of Israel answered and said, My lord, O king, according to thy saying, I am thine, and all that I have.

verses.text_plain: And the messengers came again, and said, Thus speaketh Ben–hadad, saying, Although I have sent unto thee, saying, Thou shalt deliver me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy wives, and thy children;
verses.verse_html: 5And the messengers came again, and said, Thus speaketh Ben–hadad, saying, Although I have sent unto thee, saying, Thou shalt deliver me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy wives, and thy children;

verses.text_plain: Yet I will send my servants unto thee to morrow about this time, and they shall search thine house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatsoever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away.
verses.verse_html:
6Yet I will send my servants unto thee to morrow about this time, and they shall search thine house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatsoever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away. ▼
▼ pleasant: Heb. desirable

verses.text_plain: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Mark, I pray you, and see how this man seeketh mischief: for he sent unto me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I denied him not.
verses.verse_html:
7Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Mark, I pray you, and see how this man seeketh mischief: for he sent unto me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I denied him not. ▼
▼ I denied…: Heb. I kept not back from him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I denied…: Heb. I kept not back from him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I denied…: Heb. I kept not back from him

verses.text_plain: And all the elders and all the people said unto him, Hearken not unto him, nor consent.
verses.verse_html: 8And all the elders and all the people said unto him, Hearken not unto him, nor consent.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore he said unto the messengers of Ben–hadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first I will do: but this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed, and brought him word again.
verses.verse_html: 9Wherefore he said unto the messengers of Ben–hadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first I will do: but this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed, and brought him word again.

verses.text_plain: And Ben–hadad sent unto him, and said, The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.
verses.verse_html:
10And Ben–hadad sent unto him, and said, The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me. ▼
▼ follow…: Heb. are at my feet

footnotes.body_text: ▼ follow…: Heb. are at my feet
footnotes.body_html: ▼ follow…: Heb. are at my feet

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him that girdeth on his harness boast himself as he that putteth it off.
verses.verse_html: 11And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him that girdeth on his harness boast himself as he that putteth it off.

tokens.text: himself as he that putteth it off

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when Ben–hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings in the pavilions, that he said unto his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city.
verses.verse_html:
12And it came to pass, when Ben–hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings in the pavilions, that he said unto his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city. ▼
▼ message: Heb. word
 , ▼
▼ pavilions: or, tents
 , ▼
▼ Set yourselves…: or, Place the engines. And they placed the engines

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Set yourselves…: or, Place the engines. And they placed the engines
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Set yourselves…: or, Place the engines. And they placed the engines

verses.text_plain: And, behold, there came a prophet unto Ahab king of Israel, saying, Thus saith the Lord, Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thine hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
13And, behold, there came a prophet unto Ahab king of Israel, saying, Thus saith the Lord, Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thine hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord. ▼
▼ came: Heb. approached

verses.text_plain: And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus saith the Lord, Even by the young men of the princes of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall order the battle? And he answered, Thou.
verses.verse_html:
14And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus saith the Lord, Even by the young men of the princes of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall order the battle? And he answered, Thou. ▼
▼ young…: or, servants
 , ▼
▼ order: Heb. bind, or, tie

footnotes.body_html: ▼ order: Heb. bind, or, tie

verses.text_plain: Then he numbered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty two: and after them he numbered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.
verses.verse_html: 15Then he numbered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty two: and after them he numbered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.

verses.text_plain: And they went out at noon. But Ben–hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty and two kings that helped him.
verses.verse_html: 16And they went out at noon. But Ben–hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty and two kings that helped him.

verses.text_plain: And the young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben–hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out of Samaria.
verses.verse_html: 17And the young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben–hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out of Samaria.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Whether they be come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they be come out for war, take them alive.
verses.verse_html: 18And he said, Whether they be come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they be come out for war, take them alive.

tokens.text: or whether they be come out

verses.text_plain: So these young men of the princes of the provinces came out of the city, and the army which followed them.
verses.verse_html: 19So these young men of the princes of the provinces came out of the city, and the army which followed them.

verses.text_plain: And they slew every one his man: and the Syrians fled; and Israel pursued them: and Ben–hadad the king of Syria escaped on an horse with the horsemen.
verses.verse_html: 20And they slew every one his man: and the Syrians fled; and Israel pursued them: and Ben–hadad the king of Syria escaped on an horse with the horsemen.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Syrians with a great slaughter.
verses.verse_html: 21And the king of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Syrians with a great slaughter.

verses.text_plain: And the prophet came to the king of Israel, and said unto him, Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest: for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.
verses.verse_html: 22And the prophet came to the king of Israel, and said unto him, Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest: for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.

verses.text_plain: And the servants of the king of Syria said unto him, Their gods are gods of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we; but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
verses.verse_html: 23And the servants of the king of Syria said unto him, Their gods are gods of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we; but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.

verses.text_plain: And do this thing, Take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their rooms:
verses.verse_html: 24And do this thing, Take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their rooms:

verses.text_plain: And number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened unto their voice, and did so.
verses.verse_html:
25And number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened unto their voice, and did so. ▼
▼ that thou…: Heb. that was fallen

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that thou…: Heb. that was fallen
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that thou…: Heb. that was fallen

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben–hadad numbered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.
verses.verse_html:
26And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben–hadad numbered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel. ▼
▼ to fight…: Heb. to the war with Israel

tokens.text: And it came to pass at the return

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to fight…: Heb. to the war with Israel
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to fight…: Heb. to the war with Israel

verses.text_plain: And the children of Israel were numbered, and were all present, and went against them: and the children of Israel pitched before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Syrians filled the country.
verses.verse_html:
27And the children of Israel were numbered, and were all present, and went against them: and the children of Israel pitched before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Syrians filled the country. ▼
▼ were all…: or, were nourished

footnotes.body_html: ▼ were all…: or, were nourished

verses.text_plain: And there came a man of God, and spake unto the king of Israel, and said, Thus saith the Lord, Because the Syrians have said, The Lord is God of the hills, but he is not God of the valleys, therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thine hand, and ye shall know that I am the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 28And there came a man of God, and spake unto the king of Israel, and said, Thus saith the Lord, Because the Syrians have said, The Lord is God of the hills, but he is not God of the valleys, therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thine hand, and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

verses.text_plain: And they pitched one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined: and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians an hundred thousand footmen in one day.
verses.verse_html: 29And they pitched one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined: and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians an hundred thousand footmen in one day.

tokens.text: it was, that in the seventh

verses.text_plain: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and there a wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand of the men that were left. And Ben–hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber.
verses.verse_html:
30But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and there a wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand of the men that were left. And Ben–hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber. ▼
▼ into an…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. into a chamber within a chamber

footnotes.body_text: ▼ into an…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. into a chamber within a chamber
footnotes.body_html: ▼ into an…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. into a chamber within a chamber

verses.text_plain: And his servants said unto him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, I pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: peradventure he will save thy life.
verses.verse_html: 31And his servants said unto him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, I pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: peradventure he will save thy life.

tokens.text: unto him, Behold now, we have heard
let us, I pray thee, put

verses.text_plain: So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, Thy servant Ben–hadad saith, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? he is my brother.
verses.verse_html: 32So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, Thy servant Ben–hadad saith, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? he is my brother.

tokens.text: I pray thee, let me live

verses.text_plain: Now the men did diligently observe whether any thing would come from him, and did hastily catch it: and they said, Thy brother Ben–hadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Ben–hadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.
verses.verse_html: 33Now the men did diligently observe whether any thing would come from him, and did hastily catch it: and they said, Thy brother Ben–hadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Ben–hadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.

tokens.text: to him; and he caused him to come up

verses.text_plain: And Ben–hadad said unto him, The cities, which my father took from thy father, I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. Then said Ahab, I will send thee away with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and sent him away.
verses.verse_html:
34And Ben–hadad said unto him, The cities, which my father took from thy father, I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. Then said Ahab, I will send thee away with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and sent him away. ▼
▼ streets: or, market places

tokens.text: with him, and sent him away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ streets: or, market places

verses.text_plain: And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said unto his neighbour in the word of the Lord, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.
verses.verse_html: 35And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said unto his neighbour in the word of the Lord, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.

tokens.text: me, I pray thee. And the man

verses.text_plain: Then said he unto him, Because thou hast not obeyed the voice of the Lord, behold, as soon as thou art departed from me, a lion shall slay thee. And as soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him, and slew him.
verses.verse_html: 36Then said he unto him, Because thou hast not obeyed the voice of the Lord, behold, as soon as thou art departed from me, a lion shall slay thee. And as soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him, and slew him.

tokens.text: he unto him, Because thou hast not obeyed
behold, as soon as thou art departed
thee. And as soon as he was departed

verses.text_plain: Then he found another man, and said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, so that in smiting he wounded him.
verses.verse_html:
37Then he found another man, and said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, so that in smiting he wounded him. ▼
▼ so that…: Heb. smiting and wounding

tokens.text: me, I pray thee. And the man

footnotes.body_text: ▼ so that…: Heb. smiting and wounding
footnotes.body_html: ▼ so that…: Heb. smiting and wounding

verses.text_plain: So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with ashes upon his face.
verses.verse_html: 38So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with ashes upon his face.

verses.text_plain: And as the king passed by, he cried unto the king: and he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man unto me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he be missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver.
verses.verse_html:
39And as the king passed by, he cried unto the king: and he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man unto me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he be missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver. ▼
▼ pay: Heb. weigh

verses.text_plain: And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said unto him, So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it.
verses.verse_html:
40And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said unto him, So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it. ▼
▼ he was…: Heb. he was not

tokens.text: here and there, he was gone

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he was…: Heb. he was not
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he was…: Heb. he was not

verses.text_plain: And he hasted, and took the ashes away from his face; and the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.
verses.verse_html: 41And he hasted, and took the ashes away from his face; and the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.

verses.text_plain: And he said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Because thou hast let go out of thy hand a man whom I appointed to utter destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life, and thy people for his people.
verses.verse_html: 42And he said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Because thou hast let go out of thy hand a man whom I appointed to utter destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life, and thy people for his people.

tokens.text: whom I appointed to utter destruction

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased, and came to Samaria.
verses.verse_html: 43And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased, and came to Samaria.
